intro: Polyadoa camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon polyadoa, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth surface and a waxy texture. It is often found growing in moist, shaded areas along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth.
